Hi,

The only thin=
g I saw that looks off is calling loader.findClass(...).  Custom classloade=
rs should override loadClass(), not findClass().  findClass() should be cal=
led automatically, if necessary, by the JVM's ClassLoader.  Typically if yo=
u violate the ClassLoader API contract like this you'll run into nasty prob=
lems like the problems JUnit has with reloading classes.

Why not just take=
 JUnit and customize/fix the source for your needs?  Certainly would be eas=
ier for someone like me to comprehend your changes here, since I am more fa=
miliar with JUnit's code than your project's code.  There are definitely so=
me corners in JUnit where you'll find it necessary (and usually much easier=
) to modify JUnit itself to do what you want.

Best,
Scott Stirling
